intro: Coprosma × molokaiensis, commonly known as the Molokaʻi coprosma, is a hybrid shrub native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with dark green to purplish leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
